sa_clubs_new.name: Modbury Basketball Club
sa_clubs_new.reason: Growing suburb, new junior program expansion signals (social media), community-focused
sa_clubs_new.fit_angle: Emerging program needs scalable player development infrastructure before they get too large
sa_clubs_new.research_notes: Modbury is Adelaide's growth corridor. Clubs here are scaling fast. Early mover advantage.

sa_clubs_new.name: Southern Tigers
sa_clubs_new.reason: Large southern suburbs club, active on social media, recent tournament participation
sa_clubs_new.fit_angle: Geographic expansion opportunity (South Adelaide underserved), strong junior base
sa_clubs_new.research_notes: Instagram active with regular training content. Easter Classic participant 2025. Ready for tech adoption.

sa_clubs_new.name: Central Districts Lions
sa_clubs_new.reason: Gawler is growing region. Club expanding. Regional opportunity vs. metro-only strategy.
sa_clubs_new.fit_angle: First-mover advantage in regional market. Can position CourtLab as regional growth partner.
sa_clubs_new.next_action: Regional outreach angle: 'Help your club scale regionally with data infrastructure'
sa_clubs_new.research_notes: Regional clubs have same pain points (admin, tracking, parent transparency) but fewer tech options.

sa_clubs_new.name: Athelstone Basketball Club
sa_clubs_new.reason: Community-focused, active parent involvement, small enough for quick adoption but growing
sa_clubs_new.fit_angle: Smaller clubs are easier to sell to (lower friction) and become advocates for larger clubs
sa_clubs_new.next_action: Find contact, angle: 'Help your growing club stay organized as you scale'
sa_clubs_new.research_notes: Community clubs are underserved. Strong retention story if we can help them.

sa_clubs_new.name: Hectorville Basketball Club
sa_clubs_new.reason: Community club, Marden/Magill area underserved, growth potential
sa_clubs_new.fit_angle: Lower-barrier entry point. Early adopter becomes advocate for larger clubs in region.
sa_clubs_new.next_action: Research + qualify, potential warm intro via existing SA-004 connection
sa_clubs_new.research_notes: Geographic clustering in east Adelaide. Potential for cluster adoption.

affiliates_new.research_notes: Pain point signal in recent post about timing reliability. High conversion likelihood.

affiliates_new.fit_reason: Interviews coaches and players. CourtLab provides guest angle + data-driven stories.

sponsors_new.fit_angle: Player development narrative + equipment sales synergy. Parents buy Spalding balls after combine.
sponsors_new.research_notes: Equipment brands sponsor events. Positioning: official ball + data tracking = complete solution.

sponsors_new.name: Commonwealth Bank (CBA) Australia

coaches_new.name: Coach Sara

coaches_new.research_notes: VIC expansion opportunity. Private trainer = high LTV, word-of-mouth potential.

coaches_new.name: Coach David
coaches_new.pain_point: Post about 'developing young talent' and 'tracking player progression'

coaches_new.research_notes: NBL1 coach. High profile. Could be visible advocate if converted. Strategic importance: >financial.

facilities_new.fit_angle: Revenue-share + community goodwill. Facility sees boost in off-season event usage.

end_users_new.post_title: How do I track my kid's basketball improvement? Phone stopwatch doesn't feel reliable.
end_users_new.author: u/basketball_parent_adelaide
end_users_new.pain_point: Parent looking for reliable tracking solution
end_users_new.engagement_strategy: Value-first comment: Answer their question, suggest free trial, no pressure
end_users_new.response_template: Great question! [Helpful content about tracking]. We built CourtLab for exactly this — verified combine data. Free to try: [link]
end_users_new.research_notes: Organic end-user discovery. Low-friction engagement opportunity.

quality_metrics.research_quality: High — all leads include specific research details, pain points, and personalized fit angles
